title: Ticket #2264: Review Request: Support for stateful clouds in condor deltacloud
description:
In order for the deltacloud functionality in gridmanager to work with stateful clouds (such as RHEV-M), some changes to the deltacloud_gahp and dcloudjob.cpp must be made. A patch series was sent to Jaime on June 21, 2011 with a number of bugfixes and this functionality included.

I'm opening this review request based on the advice of Matt Farrellee.
remarks:
2011-Jun-23 10:18:23 by tstclair:
If patches could be attached to the ticket that would be useful for future archaeology.

2011-Jun-27 14:42:42 by jfrey:
Here are my comments on the patches:

  • As an optimization, the results of the DELTACLOUD_GET_MAX_NAME_LENGTH and DELTACLOUD_START_AUTO gahp commands should be saved in the DCloudResource object.

  • In patch 9, there's a redundant comparison between now and lastSubmitAttempt + submitInterval.

  • The ATTR_DELTACLOUD_NEEDS_START attribute should be cleared from the job ad in GM_CLEAR_REQUEST.

2011-Jul-01 10:29:31 by jfrey:
Changes for the items I mentioned above could be done as an additional set of patches.

2011-Jul-05 09:41:34 by clalance:
Yep, those sound like useful changes. I've also found one bug while testing the patch set out. I'll make the changes you suggest, and send out a new patchset with those changes plus my bugfix.

2011-Jul-05 10:00:31 by clalance:
Actually, I'm not sure what to do about the first point. While we certainly could save the MAX_LENGTH and the START_AUTO in the jobAd, it wouldn't gain us all that much. We only go through those code paths during initial submission, and we never reference those variables once we've used them the first time. The only place where this would make a difference would be if we were going to do an automatic re-submit from CLEAR_REQUEST -> UNSUBMITTED, which we don't use and I don't think we have tested at present. Jaime, is this what you were thinking about, or was there another reason you wanted to cache those values?

2011-Jul-05 13:10:35 by jfrey:
I'm suggesting that the MAX_LENGTH and AUTO_START answers be cached in the DCloudResource class in memory in the gridmanager, not in the job ad of each job. The advantage is that when you have a dozen jobs submitted to the same DeltaCloud server, you only need to query MAX_LENGTH and AUTO_START once. I'm not suggesting that the answers be stored persistently; if the gridmanager exits and restarts, it would query the server again.

2011-Jul-05 13:44:56 by tstclair:
libdeltacloud 0.9 src ref : http://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/buildinfo?buildID=250065

2011-Jul-11 09:37:51 by clalance:
Jaime, OK, I see. Can you apply the rest of the patches for now, and then we can do a follow-up for that optimization? Thanks.

2011-Jul-11 10:07:28 by clalance:
Oops, of course I need to send out an updated patch set. I'll do that right now.

2011-Jul-13 16:26:49 by jfrey:
I've committed the patches to V7_6-branch for 7.6.3.
